pr_title: Fix max-int limit for number of points reduced in geo_centroid

timeline.message:
Fix max-int limit for number of points reduced in geo_centroid

A bug in InternalGeoCentroid#reduce existed that summed up
the aggregation's long-valued counts into a local integer variable.
Since it is definitely possible to reduce more than Integer.MAX points,
this change simply updates that variable to be a long-valued number.

Closes #55992.

timeline.bodyText: Huh! The count member variable was always a long!
timeline.author: nik9000

timeline.bodyText: Usually the reducing result is in the list, right?
timeline.author: nik9000

replies.bodyText: I suppose I was not really interested in the semantics of how this method was used in the real world, and more interested in the reduce logic itself -- as it is returned. should I change this?
replies.author: talevy

replies.bodyText: It'd make me feel better if you did maxValueGeoCentroid.reduce(singletonList(maxValueGeoCentroid), null).
replies.author: nik9000
